sourceDesc.p: M.R. James, Descriptive Catalogue of the Manuscripts in the Library of Corpus Christi College, Cambridge 1912

projectDesc.p: The James Catalogue was digitized then marked up following the TEI P5 Guidelines. The customized model was provided by Giuliano Di Bacco, stored in an ODD file (parkerweb.xml): the latter was written by GDB using ROMA vers. 2.x, with manual adaptations. The ODD file is used as a source to compile the actual schema used to validate the xml: it is advisable to compile it in RelaxNG sintax (parkerweb.rnc) through ROMA.

msDesc.head: Peter of Blois, archdeacon of Bath, Compendium in Iob etc. John of Hildesheim OCarm, Historia trium regum
Petrus Blesensis etc. Historia Trium Regum
msDesc.p:
Paper, 289 197
11.3 x 8, ff. 91, 33 lines to a page. Cent. xv late, in a clear hand.
Collation: a12-d12 (wants 12) e12 f12 g10 h10.

msItem.head: Peter of Blois, archdeacon of Bath, Compendium in Iob

head.title: Tractatus super Job directus regi Angliae per Petrum Blessensem

msItem.incipit: Henrico dei gratia illustrissimo
msItem.ab: (Giles III 19)
msItem.incipit: Vir erat etc. Tria hic ponuntur
msItem.explicit: triumphat et regnat per omnia secula seculorum. Amen
msItem.incipit: Job filius Sare de bosra rex ydumeorum
msItem.ab: From Isidore and Gregory
See also MS 177. 25, MS 451, 7

head.title: De omnibus Sibillis et nominibus earum, et de origine et de patria et de actibus earum a diebus Alexandri Magni

msItem.incipit: Sibille generaliter omnes femine dicantur prophetantes
msItem.ab: Ten Sibyls: the vision of the nine suns etc.
msItem.incipit: Iudicii signum etc.
Tunc iudicabit dominus etc.
msItem.explicit: Et regnabit dominus cum sanctis in secula seculorum. Amen
msItem.ab: Printed among Bede's works (Basil. 1563, T. II): Opsopoeus, Sibyllina, p. 515 etc. See Alexandre II 290

msItem.head: Robert Grosseteste, De probacione uirginitatis beatae Mariae (translated excerpt from Lexicon Suida)

head.title: Narratio ex libro qui Graece vocatur Suda, et cetera de Theodosio quodam ludeorum principe

msItem.rubric: Narracio ex libro qui grece vocatur Suda quem tempore theo(do)sii iuuenis composuerunt uiri sapientes isti. hendemus, Rector, Eugenilis, ffrigius, Zozinus, Gazeus, Cecilius, Siculus, longinus, Cassinus, luparcus, Beriricius, Justinus, Sophista, Pamphilius, Zopirion, et PolionThese names are corrupted forms of those given in the Prooemium to the Lexicon of Suidas
msItem.incipit: Temporibus piissimi Imperatoris Justiniani
msItem.ab: This is the article Ιησους from the Lexicon of Suidas in a Latin version made by or for Robert Grosseteste
msItem.rubric: Completa est narracio ex libro qui grece Suda vocatur quem composuerunt viri sapientes memorati quam transtulit magister R. Lincoln. Episcopus a greco in latinum videlicet de virginitate et fecunditate beate virginis marie et de filio eius Ihesu qualiter electus erat in sacerdotem in templum domini
msItem.ab: See Val. Rose in Hermes V 155

head.title: Collectanea ex diversis autoribus de virgine Maria

msItem.rubric: Sequitur de genealogia domini et omnipharia dei genitricis marie
msItem.incipit: Johannes damascenus dicit c. 88 (or gg) titulo de genealogia domini et omnipharia dei genitricis marie quod dauid duos filios habuit
Anna et esmeria sorores fuerunt
msItem.ab: with verses
msItem.rubric: Qualiter beata maria fuit admirabilis in conuersacione
msItem.incipit: Erat autem maria in ammiracione omni populo israel
msItem.ab: eadem hora saluus in domum suam remeabat
Angelus ad virginem subintrans in conclaue
msItem.explicit: vita frui beata post hoc exilium. Amen
msItem.incipit: Aue maria etc.
msItem.ab: Extracts from Bernard, Jerome, Augustine etc.
msItem.incipit: Marianus in canonica(!) sua inter cetera de virgine gloriosa dicit quod virgo beata a quinto etatis sue anno
Assumpta est etc. anno vite sue lxiiio
msItem.ab: Verses by Petrus Lombardus and other verses follow
msItem.incipit: Nota quod Petrus Compostolanus Episcopus fecit ... antiphonam Salue regina
msItem.ab: Miracle of the veil at Constantinople
msItem.incipit: Legitur in libris annalibus quod dominus noster Iehsus Christus dictus fuit a gentibus propheta veritatis. Stature fuit procere mediocris
msItem.explicit: speciosus forma pre filiis hominum diceretur et esset
msItem.ab: (Identical in substance with the Letter of Lentulus, which is a later form of the document)
msItem.incipit: Jhesus mel in ore
Hec linea sextodecies ducta longitudinem dominici corporis ostendit
Angelorum nouem sunt ordines secundum b. gregorium
msItem.explicit: est humanitas exaltata cui est honor et gloria
msItem.rubric: Qualiter festum conceptionis beate marie virginis fuit primo inuentum et celebratum
msItem.incipit: Cum quidam rex anglie
Quidam solitarius
Julianus imperator cum ceperat
msItem.rubric: Quam utile est ieiunare vigilias beate marie virgine
msItem.incipit: Contigit anno domini mcc 35 in comitatu niuernensi
msItem.ab: and verses on those who carried Christ
msItem.rubric: Hildefonsus contra eos qui disputant de virginitate beate marie
Item in sermone de assumptione eius
msItem.ab: followed by other extracts
msItem.rubric: Incipit sentencie a diuersis doctoribus excerpte. Johannes Apostolus de caritate
msItem.incipit: Deus caritas est
msItem.ab: Ending
(Isidore)
msItem.incipit: Bipertita est causa peccandi

msItem.head: Richard the Praemonstratensian, De canone missae
Exposition of the Mass (Remigius of Auxerre?)
msItem.incipit: In virtute sancte crucis et sacramento altaris
msItem.ab: Ending:
msItem.explicit: non est danda licencia ut implicent se negociis secularibus

msItem.head: John of Hildesheim OCarm, Historia trium regum

head.title: De gestis et translationibus trium regum Magorum

msItem.ab: Table of Chapters (xlv)
msItem.incipit: In primo capitulo huius libri qui est collectus de gestis et translacionibus sanctorum trium regum
msItem.ab: Text
msItem.incipit: Cum venerandorum trium regum magorum
msItem.ab: Ends
msItem.explicit: nec ut olim reuersuri sunt per uiam aliam
msItem.ab:
The text is by John of Hildesheim. It is printed by Horstmann with the old English version in Three Kings of Cologne E. E. T. S. Another copy is inMS 275.
(Meditatio Anselmi, cf. MS 177 art. 12, etc.)
msItem.incipit: Cum anima manet in corpora uiuit homo
msItem.explicit: ad quam nos perducat qui nos creauit. Amen
msItem.incipit: Inprimis dominum deum dilige ex toto corde
msItem.explicit: nec in cor hominis ascendit que preparauit deus hiis qui diligunt eum
msItem.ab: Later note
A man schuld pray to almyhtty god to ȝyf hym grasce etc.
